testcase.name: Metaswitch Interop: Voice Mail
testcase.summary:
Tested Features:
- Voice mail

testcase.name: MGCP - v90 Modem with MGCP to Occam TGW
testcase.summary:
Test long duration of v90 modem tests from ONT subscriber to RAS.
Using MGCP signalling to Occam tgw. Confirm that modem rates are sustained at v90 for at least 2 hours with use of NSP.

testcase.name: MGCP - Call transfer `NOT` Attended
testcase.summary:
Using Metaswitch. Verify MGCP-SS and GR-303 unattended call transfer works correctly.

The call is transferred with NO period of 3way media.

Action: Setup call from B to A. NOT A TO B.
Action: Put B on hold and call C from A
Confirm: 2-way media between C and A
Confirm: 0-way media between B and A
Action: Transfer B to C occurs by hanging up A
Confirm: 2-way media between B and C
Confirm: A correctly drops out from call

testcase.name: MGCP - Call hold
testcase.summary: Using Metaswitch. Verify call hold.

testcase.name: MGCP - Call transfer Attended
testcase.summary:
Using Metaswitch. Verify attended call transfer works correctly. Must first be enabled on MetaSwitch.

The call is transferred without any period during the transfer when all 3 parties are in call together:
Setup call from B to A. NOT A TO B.
Put B on hold and call C from A
Confirm: 2-way media between C and A
Confirm: 0-way media between B and A
Transfer B to C using flashook
Confirm: 2-way media between B and C
Confirm: A correctly drops out from call

testcase.name: MGCP - Simultaneous ringing
testcase.summary:
Using Metaswitch. Verify simultaneous ringing.

Verify simultaneous ringing, multiple lines can be configured to ring based on a single line being dialed. First line to offhook gets call, other lines stop ringing.

testcase.name: MGCP - CID Suppression
testcase.summary:
Using Metaswitch. Verify caller id suppression.
Activation code *67 deactivation: *82
Call should be made anonymously when activated CID should be present when deactivated and CID is enabled on both sides.

testcase.name: MGCP - Automatic call back
testcase.summary:
Using mgcp to Metaswitch. Verify automatic call back feature. Used when subscriber is trying to reach a remote party that is busy. Dialing *66 will tell the switch to check the number you last dialed. If it's still busy, the switch will prompt you regarding the retry time.
When the line is available the remote party will be rung from switch, the switch will also ring the local subscriber with a distinctive cadence to alert them that this is the auto call back service.

testcase.name: MGCP - Anonymous call rejection
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP to Metaswitch.
Verify that this can be remotely configured via starcodes, switch may handle the functionality of the feature.
Anonymous calls should be rejected.

Re-written by Grace Wu
****************************
For 6.0R2, Anonymous call rejection feature is tested for MGCP.
Verify
1) Anonymous call rejection (*77) should be able to block any incoming calls that have caller ID blocking set on.
2) Anonymous call rejection cancel (*87) should be able to cancel Anonymous call rejection and allow any incoming calls that have caller ID blocking set on.

Anonymous Call Rejection must first be enabled at the MetaSwitch

Anonymous call rejection and Anonymous call rejection are not on a per call basis and will not reset when the phone is placed on the hook

testcase.name: gr303 - Automatic recall *69 level 2
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP to Metaswitch.
Verify automatic recall *69 level 2 works correctly. Level 2 should provide another level of interaction with the softswitch, usually a voice automated menu.

testcase.name: MGCP - Teen services
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP to both CopperCom and Metaswitch. Verify teen service functionality

Expecting this function to live on the switch for first round of ONT implementation.

Teen services should allow the same ONT subscriber line to share multiple numbers and call features dictated by the switch. The switch should use the ALERT-INFO header to signal distinctive ringing to distinguish which number has been called.

In the initial RQNT message that the switch sends to the subscriber, look at the Parameters portion of the MGCP part of the packet. The Signal requests section will have a part that says L/RG or L/R1 or L/R2 or L/R3 or L/R4 or L/R5. L refers to the Line package of MGCP, R1 through 5 refer to the various ring types

testcase.name: MGCP - Denied Termination
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Function first enabled at softswitch and then accessed from endpoint via *60 or *80. Verify that lines configured for this limit of service do not have any negative side effects specific to the ONT.

testcase.name: MGCP - Denied Origination
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Function must first be enabled at MetaSwitch (call barring). It's then activated at the endpoint via star code (*341) and deactivated (*351). Verify that lines configured for this limit of service do not have any negative side effects specific to the ONT.

testcase.name: MGCP - Warmline
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Verify Warmline feature.

testcase.name: MGCP - Hotline
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Verify Hotline feature. Hotline number should be configured on the UA (possibly by starcode) per admin via the configuration interface of the ONT. Upon offhook event the ONT should dial this configured number.

testcase.name: MGCP - Call forwarding Variable
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP to Metaswitch.

Verify call forwarding.
First enable it at Metaswitch.
Then test using activation code *72 and deactivation code *73

Also test that cancel call forwarding works and that all calls after it is canceled work properly both in the ingress and egress. Also make sure that the CallerID functionality is working when the next call comes in.

testcase.name: MGCP - Two-digit speed dial (spd30)
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP Metaswitch. Verify that speed dialing works using two-digit speed dial (speed dial 30). This must enabled for subscriber line, specifically `two digit`, on the MetaSwitch. This is usually access *75. The switch will provide a stutter tone to indicate the user is in config mode, then the user enters the placeholder ie spd30 uses digits 20-49, then the user enters the number they would like to store followed by the # key.
The user can then send the 20-49 digit (sometimes requiring # after) and the switch should speed dial the configured number referenced by the digit sent.

testcase.name: MGCP - One-digit speed dial (spd8)
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP to the Metaswitch. Verify that one-digit speed dialing (spd8) works. This must be enabled for subscriber line on MetaSwitch first. This is usually accessed by *74. The switch will provide a stutter tone to indicate the user is in config mode, then the user enters the placeholder ie spd8 uses digits 2-9, then the user enters the number they would like to store followed by the # key.
The user can then send the 2-9 digit (sometimes requiring # after) and the switch should speed dial the configured number referenced by the digit sent.

testcase.name: MGCP - RTP- verify correct packetization rate negotiated
testcase.summary: Sniff RTP traffic to make sure that what the ONT negotiates in terms of ptime/packetization rates is actually used in the RTP intervals.

testcase.name: MGCP - distinctive ringing
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Verify distinctive ringing on ONT. Distinctive ringing is configured for individual subscriber lines on the Metaswitch under Teen Services. This feature allows other numbers to be directed to that line, and they have a distinctive ring (useful for giving `teen`agers the sense of having their own phone number). The new directory number can be automatically assigned with a number range for testing purposes.

testcase.name: MGCP - 3way calling switch mux
testcase.summary:
Using mgcp to Metaswitch. Verify 3way calling. have the switch mux the streams for this case.

3way calls are set up by placing the caller on hold (pressing flash), dialing and connecting to a third party, then pressing flash again.

testcase.name: MGCP - VMWI
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Verify visual message waiting indicator is activated by using an VMWI capable phone off the ONT. Msg waiting indicator is typically a flashing `charge/in use` light.
testcase.preconditions: MS softswitches, handsets, VMWI capable phone

testcase.name: MGCP - AMWI
testcase.summary: Using mgcp to Metaswitch. Verify audible message waiting indicator is indicated by stutter dial tone on the ONT.

testcase.name: MGCP - Reorder/howler/ Off hook warning tone/etc
testcase.summary: Using MGCP-SS to Metaswitch and GR-303. Verify an offhook warning is played when the phone is left offhook and idle too long.

testcase.name: MGCP - IP disconnect during call, before/after RSIP
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. Disconnect the ONT from IP connectivity to the softswitch during different states, during a call, after and before registration, etc...

testcase.name: MGCP - call waiting
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch. verify call waiting

testcase.name: MGCP - (LCFO)forward/network disconnect
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to Metaswitch.Verify forward disconnect

testcase.name: MGCP -CWCID
testcase.summary: Using Metaswitch.Verify call waiting Caller ID.

testcase.name: MGCP -CID with number, name, date delivery
testcase.summary:
Using Metaswitch. Verify Caller ID.
If supported verify number, name and date delivery.

testcase.name: MGCP - Verify basic mgcp bulk call testing
testcase.summary: Using Metaswitch. Configure bulk mgcp calls to run for an extended duration of time. Verify an acceptable success rate.

testcase.name: MGCP - Verify basic handset call a->b on diff units
testcase.summary: Using Metaswitch. Configure MGCP SS and GR-303 calls between an ONT and another ONT not using the same unit for each pots port. Verify with handsets that a basic call can be made.

testcase.name: MGCP - Verify basic handset call a->b on same unit
testcase.summary: Using Metaswitch. Configure MGCP SS and GR-303 calls between the ONT's 1st and 2nd pots ports. Verify with handsets that a basic call can be made.

testcase.name: MGCP - pulse dialing
testcase.summary:
Confirm that pulse dialing works. test digits 0-9 and * and # if supported by switch.

11= *

testcase.name: MGCP- AMWI
testcase.summary: Using MGCP to both CopperCom and Metaswitch. Verify audible message waiting indicator is indicated by stutter dial tone on the ONT.

testcase.name: MGCP - Cancel Call Waiting (*70)
testcase.summary:
Feature
VOIP

SubFeature
Cancel Call Waiting

Summary
Because of some issues seen in the field with CCW this test should be executed that it is still working with the Metaswitch and TGW.

INITIALIZATION PHASE

1. Verify BLC software version
2. Verify blacklist alarm state is clear
3. Check memory available
4. Check network connectivity
5. Verify system logging is configured (SNMP/syslog)


TESTING PHASE
1. Use a 4.x ONT to create a call with cancel call waiting enabled by using *70 before dialing the outbound number.
2. Call into this line from another subscriber and ensure that the line goes to busy.
3. Repeat this steps using MGCP/MGCPSS/GR303 lines.

CLOSING PHASE
1. Tear down connections for test tools and stop the running traffic or calls.
2. Record statistics from the test run.
3. Record any logged errors or anomalies
4. Verify clean teardown of traffic and calls
5. Check alarms

testcase.name: 25874 - Interop MGCP - Stn hook flashes after CW - silence
testcase.summary:
Summary:
This test is to check the fix for bug 25874


Feature: MGCP
Sub-Feature:

Requirements: ???
Bug: 25874

INITIALIZATION PHASE
1. Verify current BLC/ONT software version
2. Check memory available


TESTING PHASE
Having BLC 6322, ONTs (2445, 2442) and Nortel SS:
- Pick up phone and hook flash during dial tone.
- Station A calls Station B which answers and establishes conversation.
- When a call is up, hook flash and get dial tone. Then hook flash back and verify dial tone does not continue to generate.
- Station C calls Station B and hears RBT. Station C hook flashes, then hears only talk battery - despite repeated hook flashes.
- Also verify when a call-waiting call is received a hook flash will disable the call waiting tone.

For more details, please, see bug 25874


CLOSING PHASE
1. Record any logged errors or anomalies
2. Check alarms/vlm
3. Check memory

testcase.name: 25871 - Interop MGCP Intermittent no dial tone
testcase.summary:
Summary:
This test is to check the fix for bug 25871


Feature: MGCP
Sub-Feature:

Requirements: ???
Bug: 25871

INITIALIZATION PHASE
1. Verify current BLC software version
2. Check memory available


TESTING PHASE
Having a BLC 6322 and ONT (2445, 2442), go off hook many times.
Bug describes that intermittently no dial tone when going off hook.

For more details, please, see bug 25871


CLOSING PHASE
1. Record any logged errors or anomalies
2. Check alarms/vlm
3. Check memory

testcase.name: 25231 -WCR-Call waiting Caller ID continues after flash hook
testcase.summary:
Summary:
This test is to check the fix for bug 25231 for West Carolina Rural


Feature: MGCP
Sub-Feature:

Requirements: ???
Bug: 25231

INITIALIZATION PHASE
1. Verify current BLC software version
2. Check memory available


TESTING PHASE

MGCP
Direct to switch (No GR-303)
CS1500

Having a BLC 6322 and ONT 2445, establish a call between A and B.
Call waiting should be set.
When a second call comes in and CW alerting begins, answering the second call
results in:

1) The calling party no longer hears ringback (correct)

2) The answering party can converse normally with the caller. (correct)

3) The answering party continues to hear CW audible notification as if the call
were still unanswered. The notification continues to interrupt the answering
party for several cycles. (Objectionable.)


------ Additional Comment #23 From pat anglum 2010-02-11 12:07 -------

Here is a trace of what appears to be a CWT problem I experienced this morning.
I'm running T96.

Phone A 10.2.41.21 414-5001
Phone B 10.2.41.22 414-6001
Phone C 10.2.41.23 414-7001

A calls B
B answers
C calls A

Last DTMF from phone C at 00:00 (min:sec)
A receives:
CWT at 0:01
CWT at 0:09
CWT at 0:19
CWT at 0:29
C hangs up 1:40
A and B stay on call
A receives:
CWT at 1:41
CWT at 1:51
CWT at 2:01
No further CWT is heard after waiting 1 more minute.

For more details, please, see bug 25231


CLOSING PHASE
1. Record any logged errors or anomalies
2. Check alarms/vlm
3. Check memory

testcase.name: 25726 - Interop MGCP GPON ONT POTS breaks DT but hears error
testcase.summary:
Summary:
This test is to check the fix for bug 25726


Feature: MGCP
Sub-Feature:

Requirements: ???
Bug: 25726

INITIALIZATION PHASE
1. Verify current BLC software version
2. Check memory available


TESTING PHASE

Having a BLC 6322 and GPON ON2445 to Nortel CS1500 (MGCP), try to make many calls to a valid subscriber.

Bug describes that caller hears error recording after dialing first digit of another station.

- Phone B goes off hook,
- hears DT (dial tone),
- dials 4,
- then hears the recording `We're sorry your call cannot be completed as dialed`.

The digit 4 is a valid digit i.e 414-xxxx
Phone B is 10.2.41.22 414-6001 ONT 2.1


------- Additional Comment #5 From Lois Greer 2010-02-12 11:04 -------

So far, everything looks normal on the ONT side.
.
.
.
it sending this until it has collected all the digits.

For some reason I think the cs1500 thinks it collected all the digits. Not
sure why. The ONT seems to be doing exactly what its told to do.


This problem was very intermittent, and has seemed to go away, according to Patrick.

For more details, please, see bug 25726.


CLOSING PHASE
1. Record any logged errors or anomalies
2. Check alarms/vlm
3. Check memory

testcase.name: MGCP- MetaSwitch Interop
testcase.summary:
Feature
Voice

SubFeature
MGCP to MetaSwitch

Summary
This test is regression to ensure that MGCP to MetaSwitch lines are working properly.

INITIALIZATION PHASE

1. Verify BLC software version
2. Verify blacklist alarm state is clear
3. Check memory available
4. Check network connectivity
5. Verify system logging is configured (SNMP/syslog)


TESTING PHASE
1. Use 3 4.x ONT srunning MGCP lines to the MetaSwitch.
2. Use the Wiki to determine which features are currently available and working.
3. Run through all of the configured features and ensure that they are working properly.
4. Record which features were testing and whether or not they were working and why.

CLOSING PHASE
1. Tear down connections for testtools and stop the running traffic or calls.
2. Record statistics from the test run.
3. Record any logged errors or anomalies
4. Verify clean teardown of traffic and calls
5. Check alarms

testcase.name: MGCP - Call Transfer Attended (3way period)
testcase.summary:
Using ports on two wedge's, confirm attended call transfer. Test for MGCP-SS and GR-303.

Action: Setup call from B to A. NOT FROM A TO B.
Action: Put B on hold and call C from A
Confirm: 2-way media between C and A
Confirm: 0-way media between B and A
Action: From A, bring B into 3-way call with A and C.
Confirm: 3-way media between A, B and C
Action: A leaves call.
Confirm: A correctly drops out from call
Confirm: 2-way media between B and C.

testcase.name: MGCP - Automatic callback
testcase.summary:
Confirm Automatic callback works properly. Must be enabled at Metaswitch for subscriber lines.

Test for MGCP-SS and GR-303 (not supported for SIP)

Action: Establish a call between B and C
Action: Dial B from A
Confirm: A plays the busy tone (or an announcement is heard).
Action: Hang up A
Action: Dial *66 from A
Confirm: A MetaSwitch announcement is played
Action: Hang up phone A.
Action: Hang up phones B and C
Confirm: Phone A starts ringing
Action: Pickup phone A
Confirm: Phone B starts ringing
Action: Answer B
Confirm: two-way media between A and B
Action: Hang up all phones

testcase.name: MGCP - Call Transfer Blind
testcase.summary:
Using MGCP-SS and GR-303. Verify blind call transfer.

Action: Create a call from B to A
Action: Blind transfer B to C occurs by hanging up A before C picks up. B should hear ring tone.
Confirm: There is never media between A and C
Confirm: A drops out of call
Confirm: two way media between B and C
Action: Hang up all phones

testcase.name: MGCP - Call Forwarding (unconditional/delayed/busy/selective
testcase.summary:
Confirm all call forwarding features work properly. Test on endpoints btw two different wedges. Test for SS and GR303.

UNCONDITIONAL:
Must first be enabled on the MetaSwitch. *72=enable; *73=disable. Dial star code and wait for stutter dialtone and then dial digits of line to be forwarded to.
Action: From A, setup unconditional call forwarding to B
Action: Call A from C
Confirm: A rings no more than once (can be zero times)
Confirm: the call is forwarded to B
Action: answer phone B
Confirm: two way media B to C
Action: hang up B and C.
Action: Cancel call forwarding on A.
Confirm: call from C to A rings at A normally, is not forwarded.

DELAYED:
Must first be enabled on the MetaSwitch. *92=enable; *93=disable. Dial star code and wait for stutter dialtone and then dial digits of line to be forwarded to.
Action: From A, setup delayed call forwarding to B
Action: Call A from C
Confirm: A rings for the configured time before forwarding (10 seconds)
Confirm: the call is forwarded to B
Action: Answer phone B
Confirm: two way media B to C
Action: Cancel call forwarding on A.
Confirm: A has dial tone.
Action: C calls A.
Confirm: Call is not forwarded to B after the configured period is passed (for example, may go to voicemail; reorder tone if no other service configured).

BUSY:
Must first be enabled on the MetaSwitch. Call-waiting must be disabled. *90=enable; *91=disable. Dial star code and wait for stutter dialtone and then dial digits of line to be forwarded to.
Action: From A, setup busy call forwarding to B
Action: Setup call between A and C
Action: Call A from D
Confirm: D is forwarded to B
Action: Answer phone B
Confirm: two way media between B and D
Confirm: two-way media persists between A and C
Action: Hang up all lines.
Action: Cancel call forwarding on A.
Action: Set up call between A and C.
Action: Call A from D.
Confirm: Call is not forwarded to B, and instead gets whatever the next configured busy treatment is (e.g. voicemail, or busy tone).

SELECTIVE:
Must first be enabled on the MetaSwitch. *63=enable. Dial star code and follow instructions.
Action: From A, setup selective call forwarding such that if B calls then B is forwarded to C
Action: Call A from B
Confirm: A rings no more than once (can be zero times)
Confirm: B is forwarded to C
Action: Answer phone C
Confirm: two way media between B and C
Confirm: A has dial-tone (then hang up).
Action: Call A from D.
Confirm: A rings as usual (or other call treatment is in place, in which case confirm that is working as expected).
Action: Cancel call forwarding.
Confirm: Calls from B are no longer forwarded to C.

testcase.name: MGCP - Fax Indirect Media
testcase.summary:
Send fax (minimum 10 pages) from fax machine to windows computer equipped with `fax console` (can be downloaded for free online) on Wedge pots lines. Confirm sent fax matches received fax (fax console will create a .TIF document of the received fax pages).

Test for wedges configured for MGCP-SS Indirect media.
testcase.preconditions: 2 wedges, fax machine and windows fax console

testcase.name: MGCP - Home Intercom (revertive ringing)
testcase.summary:
Home Intercom service must be enabled on metaswitch. Wedge should have two extension phones connected to same subscriber pots line. Test for both MGCP-SS and GR-303. There are two phases:

Phase 1: New call to other extension
Pick up one of A's phones and call A.
Confirm busy tone is heard and hang up the phone.
Confirm all A's phones ring.
Pick up two of A's phones.
Confirm ringing stops, and there is 2-way media between the phones.
Hang up the phones, and pick one up again.
Confirm dialtone heard, and able to make an outbound call.

Phase 2: Transfer call to other extension
B calls A (B is subscriber on different device than A).
One of A's phones picks up, and there is 2-way media with B.
Flash-hook on A's phone.
Should hear stutter dialtone on A's phone then hang up
Confirm all A's phones now ring.
Pick up A's other phone.
Confirm ringing stops, and there is 2-way media with B.
Hang up the phones, and pick one of A's again.
Confirm dialtone heard, and able to make an outbound call.

testcase.name: MGCP - Multiple Appearance Directory Numbers
testcase.summary:
The `multiple appearance directory number` feature allows one number to simultaneously ring a group of phones (see configu info on Metaswitch occamwiki page). When any one of those phones in the configured group answers the incoming call the remaining phones in the group are available again to receive calls. All phones that are not busy will ring when a new inbound call arrives. There are three test cases. In all, A and B are under the same MADN and on separate ONT Wedges. Test for both MGCP-SS and GR-303.

Test case A - Multiple lines available:
From C dial the MADN number
Confirm A and B ring simultaneously
Answer phone A
Confirm B stops ringing, and A is connected to C

Test case B - One line available:
Establish a call between D and A
From C dial the MADN number
Confirm only B rings
Hang up phones A and D
Confirm B continues to ring
Pick up B and confirm B is connected to C

Test case C - No lines available, queuing:
Establish a call between D and A
Establish a call between C and B
From E dial the MADN number
Confirm E is queued (hears ringback)
Hang up A and D
Confirm A starts to ring with call from E
Pick up A
Confirm 2-way media between A and E

testcase.name: MGCP - Multiple Line Hunt Groups
testcase.summary:
This feature allows a caller to dial a 'pilot number' for the group so that calls to the group are passed to a non-busy line within the Hunt Group, or may be added to a queue if all lines are busy. The non-busy lines will ring in turn according to the hunting algorithm selected, the default being a linear algorithm that tries the members in order of phone number (low to high). There are three test cases, w/ A being on DUT.
Test for both MGCP-SS and GR-303.

Test case A - B is in MLHG. Test with with A both in and out of MLHG:
From A, dial the pilot number for the MLHG.
Confirm B rings. Pick up and check 2 way audio.

Test case B - A and B are in MLHG:
Take A off hook. From C, dial the MLHG pilot number.
Confirm B rings. Pick up and check 2 way audio.
Next enable DND on A. From C, dial the pilot number for the MLHG
Confirm B rings. Pick up and check 2 way audio.

Test case C - A and B are in MLHG:
From C, E, F, G, dial the pilot number for the MLHG
Confirm A & B ring, pick up both & check 2 way audio. Confirm F is queued and then treated as busy after 15 seconds (or whatever duration is configured).
Confirm call from G is rejected.
Queue length (specifies max # of calls that can be queued) must equal 1 and queuing time must be limited to 15 on Metaswitch for MLHG.

testcase.name: DIGIT MAP basic checks
testcase.summary:
Verify that the following characteristics of the digit map:
-a minimum of 128 characters accepted in digit map
-single digit dialing, multiple digit dialing, starcodes and timer
Default digit map should resemble allowing any number of digits and timer as well as star plus timer:
x.t | *x.t
-Digit map timer should be configureable. Default should be <4 seconds. Configurable timer is not yet implemented in the system, April 2009.
